root.title: Leaves
root.author: Lloyd Schwartz

p.intro: Every October it becomes important, no, necessary
p.analogy: to see the leaves turning, to be surrounded by leaves turning; it's not just the symbolism,
p.autumn: to confront in the death of the year your death,
p.strength: though the irony isn't lost on you that nature is most seductive when it's about to die,
p.beauty: flaunting the dazzle of its incipient exit,
p.filth: an ending that at least so far the effects of human progress (pollution, acid rain)
p.strength: have not yet frightened you enough to make you believe is real;
p.cycle: that is, you know this ending is a deception because of course nature is always renewing itself—
p.natural_behavior: the trees don't die, they just pretend,
p.cycle: go out in style, and return in style: a new style.

p.captivate: Is it deliberate how far they make you go
p.adventure: especially if you live in the city to get far enough away from home to see not just trees but only trees?
p.filth: The boring highways, roadsigns, high speeds, 10-axle trucks passing you as if they were in an even greater hurry than you to look at leaves:
p.the_unknown: so you drive in terror for literal hours and it looks like rain, or snow, but it's probably just clouds (too cloudy to see any color?)
p.remember: and you wonder, given the poverty of your memory,
p.autumn: which road had the most color last year,
p.time: but it doesn't matter since you're probably too late anyway, or too early—
p.forget: which road had the most color last year,
p.loss: and you've probably come all this way for nothing.
You'll be driving along depressed when suddenly
p.metaphor: a cloud will move and the sun will muscle through and ignite the hills.
p.temporary: It may not last. Probably won't last.
p.beauty: But for a moment the whole world comes to. Wakes up. Proves it lives.
p.autumn: It lives— red, yellow, orange, brown, russet, ocher, vermilion, gold.
p.blending: Flame and rust. Flame and rust, the permutations of burning.
p.exaggeration: You're on fire. Your eyes are on fire.
p.powerful: It won't last, you don't want it to last. You can't stand any more.
p.beauty: But you don't want it to stop.
p.cycle: It's what you've come for. It's what you'll come back for.
p.unique: but you'll remember that it felt like nothing else you've felt
p.temporary: or something you've felt that also didn't last.
